author: lefty.crupps
message:
> Note that I escaped the ‘.’ in “foo.”, because
> msrp supports Perl 5 regular expressions.

So why not escape the '.' in the immediatly-following 'bar.' ? Or why not explain why not to escape that one?

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Because regular expressions are only used to specify the search pattern. The replacement is not a pattern, so it does not need escaping.

author: Bruno Bigras
message:
I put a Ubuntu package containing your patches on a ppa -> https://launchpad.net/~brun...

Here's how I did using https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Pac...

apt-get source msrp

cd msrp-0.9.4

mkdir debian/patches
export QUILT_PATCHES=debian/patches
touch debian/patches/series

# tell quilt you want to create a new patch
quilt new 001_git_support.diff

# tell quilt which files to track
quilt add src/cliargs.cc src/cliopt.cc src/cliopt.h

# edit the files
patch -p1 < /home/bruno/Téléchargements/msrp-0.9.4-0001-git-support.diff

# generate the patch
quilt refresh

quilt new 002_bzr_support.diff
quilt add src/cliargs.cc src/cliopt.cc src/cliopt.h
patch -p1 < /home/bruno/Téléchargements/msrp-0.9.4-0002-bzr-support.diff
quilt refresh

# undo local changes (remove quilt patches)
quilt pop -a

In the debian/rules file:
- Add &#039include /usr/share/quilt/quilt.make&#039 at the top (below &#039#!/usr/bin/make -f&#039)
- Add &#039patch&#039 on the same line as &#039build-stamp:&#039
- Add &#039unpatch&#039 on the same line as &#039clean:&#039

Add &#039quilt&#039 on the &#039Build-Depends:&#039 line of the debian/control file

# increate the version thing to &#0390.9.4-2ubuntu1~ppa0&#039
dch -i

# generate the files to send to my ppa
debuild -S

# or build it locally
dpkg-buildpackage -us -uc

author: malex984
message:
i needed to improve the tool so i forked it at https://github.com/malex984...

What's new (in the master branch):
1. can use "\f" in both search and replace expression for the current file name
2. errors in renaming with git/hg/svn/bzr will be treated correctly and the plain rename used as a fall-back.

Any contributions and comments are really welcome!

ps: corresponding package for ArchLinux is at http://aur.archlinux.org/pa...
